post: Arizona elementary teachers! Join us 9/25 at ASU Chandler for a PD workshop designed to introduce our new elementary curriculum, BRI Jr.! Make meaningful connections between our history, civics, and government, ensuring relevance to the students' lives.  https://bit.ly/3H9twC3 Not in Arizona? Discover the free, engaging resources on your own on our site:  https://bit.ly/3WB3UTK

Discover the tensions of the hours before Operation Overlord, the words Gen. Eisenhower prepared in case of failure, and the quiet, resolute character that defined his command. From late-night meetings with Churchill and Montgomery to visits with young paratroopers hours before they jumped into enemy territory, witness the story of a leader who rose to the moment and helped shape the course of history. This mini-documentary is part of our Celebrating A250 series, which highlights important moments in the 250+ years of United States history.  https://bit.ly/4lKPcDF

BRI Senior Fellow, Tony Williams, recently interviewed author James Graham Wilson to examine the life and legacy of Paul Nitze, a key architect of Cold War national security policy. Drawing from his book Americas Cold Warrior: Paul Nitze and National Security from Roosevelt to Reagan, Wilson explores how Nitzes decades-long public service reflected a deep commitment to American ideals and the defense of liberty in the nuclear age. Watch it today!  https://bit.ly/4mfNXwe

How do Bill of Rights Institute classroom resources and programs prepare students for their future? Anthony Simone shares how we help young people develop valuable life skills that will serve them in their communities and throughout their careers.  https://lnkd.in/eX5xTPSn

Saturday, July 19, was the anniversary of the first womens rights convention in U. S. history opened in Seneca Falls, New York. Organized by leaders like Elizabeth Cady Stanton and Lucretia Mott, the convention brought together reformers, including Frederick Douglass, to demand equal rights for women. Attendees signed the Declaration of Sentiments, boldly declaring that all men and women are created equal,  and calling for womens suffrage and full civic equality. Find out more in our recent YouTube short! http://bit.ly/3TOCqYz

Congratulations to Vick Tan! His project, Fish Hut, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit that brings fishing and education to underserved kids in his community, earned an Honorable Mention award in our 2025 MyImpact Challenge. Learn about all our winners today!  https://bit.ly/4lP5P0u  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Congratulations to Suraj Shah and Courtney Tetteh-Martey! Star Spangled Tea, an affiliate partner of BRI, has over a dozen tea blends that have nods to historical figures and local flavors. Whether you're a history buff or a tea lover, use code 'BRI1791' to get a discount and support the Bill of Rights Institute with every purchase. A portion of your purchase helps us bring free civic education to classrooms nationwide. Visit  https://bit.ly/46ald2T to shop now.

Congratulations to Spencer Chaisanguanthum! His project, Eloquence Academy (EA ) a nonprofit organization that increases equitable public speaking and academic debate opportunities for historically underserved students through classes, tournaments, workshops, in-school programs, and online resources, earned an Honorable Mention award in our 2025 MyImpact Challenge.
